title.value: Social Neuro AI: Social Interaction as the "Dark Matter" of AI
title.justification: The title is directly mentioned in the provided text, which discusses the perspective on social interaction as a critical yet underexplored component of AI, metaphorically described as "dark matter."
title.quote: Bolotta S and Dumas G (2022) Social Neuro AI: Social Interaction as the “Dark Matter” of AI.

extractions.description: The paper discusses the importance of social interaction in AI, proposing a framework to integrate social learning mechanisms from neuroscience to enhance AI's cognitive abilities. It highlights the omission of social interactions in current AI models, comparing it to "dark matter," a critical but overlooked constituent of intelligence.

type.justification: The paper introduces a theoretical framework to integrate social learning in AI based on cognitive and social neuroscience insights, without mentioning empirical experimentation or data analysis.
type.quote: This article introduces a three-axis framework indicating how AI can be informed by biological examples of social learning mechanisms.

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the development of AI inspired by social interactions and neuroscience, encapsulated in the concept of Social Neuro AI.
name.quote: three lines of research that fall under the umbrella of Social NeuroAI and can contribute to developing socially intelligent embodied agents in complex environments.

name.justification: The paper's core argument revolves around integrating social learning from biological systems to AI, focusing on interactions and learning processes.
name.quote: The original contributions presented in the study are included in the article/supplementary material, further inquiries can be directed to the corresponding author.

name.justification: A significant portion of the paper is dedicated to discussing cognitive architectures that can support social learning in AI.
name.quote: neuroscientific theories of cognitive architecture... can enhance biological plausibility and help us understand how we could bridge individual and social theories of intelligence.

name.justification: The paper discusses the embodiment as essential for developing AI with rich communicative and interactive capabilities, enhancing their social presence.
name.quote: sophisticated array of communicative signals... we discuss the example of active inference, which offers powerful insights for developing agents that possess biological realism, can self-organize in time, and are socially embodied.
